parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
